title: Isro launches space docking satellites, India on path to elite club; PSLV last stage has 24 payloads - The Times of India
summary:
India Launches Space Docking Satellites, Joining Elite Space Club

Date: 2023-06-01, Source: The Indian Express

In a significant achievement, the Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO) successfully launched its Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV-C55) on June 1, 2023, carrying 24 payloads to space. Among these, space docking satellites mark a crucial step in India's ambition to join the elite club of nations capable of independent space docking technology.

  1. The PSLV-C55 mission marks the 55th flight of the PSLV and the 5th mission in 2023.
  2. The 24 payloads include two space docking satellites, EOS-07 and EOS-08, developed by NewSpace India Limited (NSIL).
  3. The mission also carried payloads from various international customers, including satellites from Switzerland, USA, and Luxembourg.

"This is a historic moment. We are on our way to becoming a major space power," said K. Sivan, Chairman of ISRO.

With this launch, India continues to assert its position as a key player in the global space industry, poised to contribute significantly to scientific exploration and commercialization of space.
newTitle: India Launches Space Docking Satellites, Joining Elite Space Club

title: Rahul Gandhi In Vietnam During Mourning Period For Dr Manmohan Singh, PM Modi Cancelled Dec 27 Event - News18
summary:
Rahul Gandhi In Vietnam During Mourning Period For Dr Manmohan Singh, PM Modi Cancelled Dec 27 Event

Date: December 30, 2024 Source: News

Rahul Gandhi's visit to Vietnam coincided with a mourning period following the death of former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh. Prime Minister Modi cancelled a significant event to honor Singh.

  • PM Modi was scheduled to distribute property cards to over 50 lakh people on December 27 as part of the Swamitva scheme.
  • The event was cancelled as a mark of respect following Singh's passing on December 26.
  • Government officials noted that the cancellation affected a nationwide program with large participation.
  • Congress leaders defended Gandhi's private travel amidst criticism from BJP.
  • State mourning was declared, leading to the cancellation of various government programs.
“The sentiment on social media largely portrays this action negatively, suggesting a disconnect with national sentiment.”

The event raised discussions about political respect and responses to mourning periods, reflecting broader implications within political discourse.
newTitle: Rahul Gandhi In Vietnam During Mourning Period For Dr Manmohan Singh, PM Modi Cancelled Dec 27 Event

title: Missing for over a week, Srinagar resident found dead in Ramban - Greater Kashmir
Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu richest Chief Minister, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee poorest: ADR - The Hindu
summary:
India's Chief Ministers: Wealth Gap and Criminal Cases

Date & Source: Published on December 30, 2024 08:39 pm IST, The Hindu

Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu is the richest in India with assets worth over ₹931 crore, while West Bengal's Mamata Banerjee is the poorest with just ₹15 lakh, as per an ADR report.

  • Average asset per CM: ₹52.59 crore
  • Average self-income of a CM: ₹13,64,310 (7.3 times India's average per capita income)
  • Total assets of 31 CMs: ₹1,630 crores
  • 13 CMs (42%) have declared criminal cases
  • Only 2 CMs are women
Out of the 31 Chief Ministers, 10 (32%) have declared serious criminal cases.

Published on - December 30, 2024 08:39 pm IST
newTitle: India's Chief Ministers: Wealth Gap and Criminal Cases

title: 'Against traditions': Pune pub sends condoms with New Year party invite; Youth Congress files complaint - The Times of India
summary:
Pune Pub Controversy: Condoms Sent with New Year Party Invites Sparks Outrage

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: [Insert Source Here]

An unusual New Year party invitation from a Pune pub, which included the delivery of condoms, has led to a complaint being filed by the Youth Congress, prompting discussions about tradition and modern values.

  • The pub mailed invitations with condoms to promote a safe and enjoyable celebration.
  • The Youth Congress has labeled the pub's actions as offensive and inappropriate.
  • Debates are ongoing regarding cultural values and how they align with modern practices.
"Tradition is being overlooked in favor of publicity stunts," a Youth Congress member stated.

This incident has sparked a larger conversation about how events are marketed and perceived within the community, reflecting tensions between progressive viewpoints and traditional values.
newTitle: Pune Pub Controversy: Condoms Sent with New Year Party Invites Sparks Outrage

title: ‘Objectionable’: Delhi LG on Arvind Kejriwal's ‘temporary CM’ remark on Atishi - Hindustan Times
summary:
Delhi LG Criticizes Kejriwal's 'Temporary CM' Remark on Atishi

Date: Dec 30, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Delhi's Lieutenant Governor Vinai Kumar Saxena has expressed his objection to Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal referring to Atishi as a 'temporary chief minister'. He stated that this language is offensive and misleading.

  • LG Saxena found Kejriwal's comments to be discriminatory against Atishi and the principles of the Indian Constitution.
  • Saxena emphasized the importance of respectful public discourse and criticized Kejriwal for undermining Atishi's position.
  • He pointed out that Kejriwal's long tenure as CM was marked by unaddressed issues like pollution and healthcare.
  • Saxena mentioned that Kejriwal's claims regarding Atishi involved unauthorized announcements and unfounded accusations.
“As a lieutenant governor, I am concerned about this level of public discourse and at the same time, I am hurt by the conversation of presenting the full-time chief minister of my government as a temporary chief minister.”

In conclusion, LG Saxena calls for higher standards of public discussion, especially among elected officials, to uphold the dignity of all public office holders.
newTitle: Delhi LG Criticizes Kejriwal's 'Temporary CM' Remark on Atishi

title: Pune Pub Sends Condoms With New Year Party Invite, Congress Files Complaint - NDTV
summary:
Pune Pub Sends Condoms With New Year Party Invite, Congress Files Complaint

Date: 2021-03-12 Source: NDTV

A controversy has arisen in Pune after a pub allegedly sent condoms and ORS (Oral Rehydration Solution) as invitations for a New Year's Eve party, leading to a complaint from the Maharashtra Pradesh Youth Congress.

  • The invite showcasing condoms and ORS has gone viral, prompting police involvement.
  • Congress member Akshay Jain criticized the marketing strategy as inappropriate for Pune's traditions.
  • Police confirmed that they have recorded statements from several invitees regarding the incident.
“We are not against pubs and nightlife. However, the marketing strategy to attract youngsters is against the traditions of Pune city.” - Akshay Jain

The incident raises questions about acceptable advertising methods in nightlife venues and their alignment with cultural norms.
newTitle: Controversy Over Pune Pub's New Year's Eve Invite Featuring Condoms

title: Pushpa-2 stampede case: Hyderabad court reserves Allu Arjun's bail order, hearing postponed to Jan 3 - Hindustan Times
summary:
Hyderabad Court Postpones Bail Hearing for Allu Arjun in Pushpa-2 Stampede Case

Date: December 30, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

A Hyderabad court has reserved its decision on the bail plea of actor Allu Arjun in relation to the Sandhya theatre stampede case, which resulted in the death of a woman and left a child injured. The hearing has been postponed to January 3, 2025.

  • The stampede occurred on December 4 during the Pushpa-2 premiere.
  • Allu Arjun was arrested on December 13 and was initially granted interim bail.
  • The deceased woman's family has filed a complaint leading to the case against Arjun and others.
  • The bail plea hearing has been postponed after arguments from both the police and Arjun's legal team.
“The child responded after 20 days. He is responding today. Allu Arjun and the Telangana government are supporting us.” - Bhaskar, father of the injured child

The case has generated significant public interest and outrage, highlighting the responsibility of event organizers and security.
newTitle: Hyderabad Court Postpones Bail Hearing for Allu Arjun in Pushpa-2 Stampede Case

title: "Objectionable That Arvind Kejriwal Called Atishi Temporary": Lt Governor - NDTV
summary:
Objectionable That Arvind Kejriwal Called Atishi Temporary: Lt Governor

Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

Introduction: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena expressed his discontent over Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's reference to Atishi as a 'temporary Chief Minister', stating it undermines democratic principles.

  • Saxena stated he was 'hurt' by Kejriwal's comment.
  • He emphasized that the term 'temporary Chief Minister' does not exist in the Constitution.
  • The LG praised Atishi for her governance efforts, contrasting her work with that of her predecessor, Kejriwal.
  • He listed areas where he believes the government has failed, while acknowledging Kejriwal's admissions of shortcomings.
  • Assembly elections in Delhi are scheduled for February next year.
  • Saxena had previously referred to Atishi as 'a thousand times better' than Kejriwal.
  • Atishi has yet to respond to the criticisms made by Saxena.
  • There was a prior incident in which Saxena overruled Atishi's request to hoist the national flag on Independence Day.
"This is the first time in my two-and-a-half-year tenure that I am seeing a Chief Minister discharge the duties of a Chief Minister." - Lt Governor VK Saxena

Conclusion: The ongoing tensions between the Lieutenant Governor and the Chief Minister highlight the political dynamics in Delhi ahead of the upcoming elections.
newTitle: Lt Governor Criticizes Kejriwal's Remarks on Atishi

title: With assets worth Rs 931 cr, Chandrababu Naidu richest CM; Telangana CM faces most criminal cases - Deccan Herald
summary:
Chandrababu Naidu Declared Richest CM in India with Rs 931 Cr Assets

Published on: 30 December 2024, Source: Deccan Herald

Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu ranks as the richest chief minister in India, while Telangana CM A Revanth Reddy has the highest number of criminal cases against him.

  • Naidu's assets worth Rs 931 crore surpass all other chief ministers.
  • Revanth Reddy has 89 criminal cases filed against him, with 72 considered serious.
  • Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah follows Naidu, ranking third with Rs 51 crore in assets.
  • Pema Khandu of Arunachal Pradesh is the second richest with Rs 332 crore but holds the highest liabilities at Rs 180 crore.
  • West Bengal’s Mamta Banerjee has the least assets among CMs at Rs 15 lakh.
  • 42% of the analyzed chief ministers have declared criminal cases against themselves.
“Around 10 chief ministers have declared serious criminal cases, including those related to attempted murder, kidnapping, bribery, and criminal intimidation.”

This analysis, conducted by the Association for Democratic Reforms and National Election Watch, highlights discrepancies in CM wealth and legal challenges.
newTitle: Chandrababu Naidu Declared Richest CM in India with Rs 931 Cr Assets

title: Chandrababu Naidu richest CM, Mamata ranks last; Telangana CM faces most criminal cases: ADR Report - Deccan Herald
summary:
Chandrababu Naidu: India's Richest CM; Revanth Reddy Faces Most Criminal Cases

Date & Source: 30 December 2024, 13:40 IST, Deccan Herald

With assets worth Rs 931 crore, Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu is the wealthiest among all chief ministers in the country. Meanwhile, Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy has the highest number of criminal cases filed against him, with around 89 cases, 72 of which are serious IPC counts.

  1. Naidu has assets worth Rs 931 crore and liabilities of Rs 10 crore.
  2. Reddy has the highest number of criminal cases, with 89 cases, including 72 serious IPC counts.
  3. Pema Khandu of Arunachal Pradesh is the second richest CM with assets of Rs 332 crore but has the highest liabilities of Rs 180 crore.
  4. Only two out of 31 Chief Ministers are women.
Revanth Reddy is facing charges related to criminal intimidation, bribery, cheating, and more. Following him, MK Stalin of Tamil Nadu has the highest number of cases, totaling 47, and the highest number of serious IPC cases, 11.

Conclusion: This article highlights the wealth and legal issues of chief ministers in India, with Naidu being the richest and Reddy facing the most criminal cases.
newTitle: Chandrababu Naidu: India's Richest CM; Revanth Reddy Faces Most Criminal Cases

title: Income Tax Relief: Biggest Budget 2025 demand! A look at Nirmala Sitharaman's comment - 'Middle class should...' - ET Now
summary:
Income Tax Relief: Biggest Budget 2025 demand! A look at Nirmala Sitharaman's comment - 'Middle class should...'

Updated: Dec 30, 2024

This comes as the FM Sitharaman, in the last Union Budget, increased the tax on capital gains, leading to higher rates for short-term and long-term gains. Taxpayers are demanding relief in tax rates from the finance minister.

Income Tax Budget 2025

A Reuters report indicated that the FM is likely to announce measures to lower personal income tax for specific individuals. If implemented, this could significantly benefit many taxpayers, particularly those in cities facing high living costs.

FM Nirmala Sitharaman on Income Tax Relief

In an exclusive interview, Nirmala Sitharaman expressed her intent to support the middle class, mentioning the increase of the standard deduction from Rs 50,000 to Rs 75,000. She mentioned, "I can do more, I wish to do more, but there are limitations in taxation." Sitharaman highlighted the government’s efforts to reduce the tax burden and the introduction of a new tax regime with lower rates.

Don’t blame cops for Allu Arjun’s arrest in stampede case: Pawan Kalyan - Hindustan Times
summary:
Pawan Kalyan Defends Allu Arjun, Criticizes Police and Theatre Management in Stampede Case

Date & Source: Monday, December 30, 2024, Hindustan Times

Andhra Pradesh deputy chief minister Pawan Kalyan has defended his nephew, actor Allu Arjun, following the stampede at a Hyderabad theatre that led to a woman's death, suggesting that the actor and his team should have taken more precautions. However, he refused to blame the actor or the Telangana police for the incident and subsequent arrest.

  1. Kalyan suggested that Allu Arjun's team should have reached out to the victim's family sooner.
  2. He criticized the theatre management for not taking adequate security measures and not informing Allu Arjun about the situation.
  3. Kalyan praised Telangana chief minister Revanth Reddy for supporting the film industry and refuted claims that Reddy targeted Allu Arjun.
  4. Allu Arjun was arrested on December 13 and granted interim bail on the same day.

“In cinema, it’s a team effort, and everyone should be a part of it. In this case, Allu Arjun has been made the sole culprit, which I believe is not right.”

- Pawan Kalyan

Kalyan also expressed that Allu Arjun should have visited the victim's family sooner to offer condolences and support.
newTitle: Pawan Kalyan Defends Allu Arjun, Criticizes Police and Theatre Management in Stampede Case

Introduction: A 17-year-old boy in Meerut allegedly killed his best friend for stealing intimate videos of his girlfriend from his phone and blackmailing her.

  • The accused confessed to the crime and told the police that the victim, Abhinav, had been using the videos to torture his girlfriend.
  • The victim and accused were neighbours and studying for engineering entrance exams.
  • The accused was initially suspected by the victim's father after he was missing for a day.
  • The accused confessed to murdering Abhinav after CCTV footage showed them together.
  • The accused claimed that Abhinav had started blackmailing his girlfriend after accessing the videos.
Notable Quote: The accused told the police that Abhinav had stolen some pictures as well as videos from his phone to torture his girlfriend.

Conclusion: The Uttar Pradesh Police has detained the teenage boy who confessed to killing his best friend over a blackmail incident involving his girlfriend.

title: Maldivian oppn sought ‘$6 mn from India’ in bid to impeach president Muizzu, reports WaPo - ThePrint
summary:
Maldivian Opposition Allegedly Sought $6 Million from India to Impeach President Muizzu

Date & Source: Published on The Print, April 2024

Introduction: According to a report by The Washington Post, politicians from the Maldivian Democratic Party (MDP) opposition sought $6 million from India to aid in a plot to impeach Maldives’ President Mohamed Muizzu.

  1. The report claims that an agent from India’s foreign intelligence agency, Research and Analysis Wing (R&AW), was in touch with Maldivian opposition leaders to remove President Muizzu in January 2024.
  2. An internal document titled ‘Democratic Renewal Initiative’ proposed bribing 40 members of parliament to vote to impeach Muizzu.
  3. The conspirators sought 87 million Maldivian rufiyaa, or $6 million, which was to be sought from India, according to two Maldivian officials.
  4. Senior R&AW officer in the Indian embassy in Washington DC reportedly explored ways to overthrow Muizzu with two intermediaries.

“I stand by my actions, unapologetic and resolute. If defending my country requires me to act 100 times over, I will do so without hesitation. If it means shedding the last drop of my blood to ensure my nation’s safety, so be it.” — Savio Rodrigues, journalist-politician

Conclusion: This report sheds light on the alleged involvement of Indian intelligence in Maldivian politics and the opposition's attempt to impeach the president. The development could potentially strain bilateral ties between India and the Maldives.
newTitle: Maldivian Opposition Allegedly Sought $6 Million from India to Impeach President Muizzu

Defence Min signs contracts worth Rs 2,867 crore for advanced submarine technologies

Source: Economic Times

In a significant step towards strengthening India's naval defence, the Ministry of Defence signed two major contracts worth Rs 2,867 crore. These agreements aim to enhance the capabilities of the Indian Navy's submarines, particularly the Kalvari-Class, through advanced technologies like Air Independent Propulsion (AIP) and Electronic Heavy Weight Torpedo (EHWT) systems.

  • Contracts worth Rs 2,867 crore signed by the Ministry of Defence.

title: India’s defence exports crossed record ₹21,000 crore over decade: Rajnath - The Hindu
summary:
India's Defence Exports Reach ₹21,000 Crore, Set to Aim for ₹50,000 Crore by 2029

Date: December 30, 2024
Source: The Hindu

Defence Minister Rajnath Singh announced that India's defence exports have surged to ₹21,000 crore over the last decade, with a target of reaching ₹50,000 crore by 2029.

  • Defence exports grew from ₹2,000 crore to ₹21,000 crore within ten years.
  • Mr. Singh emphasizes the significance of mastering new technologies in contemporary warfare.
  • He mentions the importance of well-trained military personnel to counter evolving threats such as AI-based warfare and cyber-attacks.
  • The Modi government is focusing on the integration of military services.
“Our defence exports, which were around ₹2,000 crore a decade ago, have crossed the record figure of ₹21,000 crore today. We have set an export target of ₹50,000 crore by 2029,” Mr. Singh said.

The Defence Minister emphasized that economic growth and security are interlinked, asserting that strengthened defence capabilities will enhance India's global standing.
newTitle: India's Defence Exports Reach ₹21,000 Crore, Set to Aim for ₹50,000 Crore by 2029

title: 'Backed' by Nara Lokesh, IAS K. Vijayanand supersedes 6 officers to become AP's new chief secy - ThePrint
summary:
K. Vijayanand Appointed as Andhra Pradesh's New Chief Secretary

Publication Date: Not specified, Source: ThePrint

K. Vijayanand, a senior IAS officer, has been appointed as the new Chief Secretary of Andhra Pradesh, superseding six other officers. His appointment is said to be supported by influential Minister Nara Lokesh.

  • Vijayanand is a 1992 IAS officer and will replace outgoing Chief Secretary Neerabh Kumar Prasad.
  • He was appointed amid controversy, having a good relationship with CM Naidu and the influential backing of Nara Lokesh.
  • Vijayanand has significant experience in the energy sector and previously served in key roles under the Naidu administration from 2014 to 2019.
  • His term could extend beyond 11 months if the government chooses to do so.
  • Several senior officers were overlooked for this position, including those with prior political affiliations that could be viewed unfavorably.
“Going by the rules, any IAS officer in the fixed grade of CS level can be appointed to the top post,” a senior official in the General Administration Department stated.

Vijayanand's appointment is seen as a strategic move by the Naidu government, aimed at leveraging his expertise in energy management to enhance the state's developmental projects.
newTitle: K. Vijayanand Appointed as Andhra Pradesh's New Chief Secretary
